item.title: Running a batch file in java
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

try {
Runtime.getRuntime().exec("cmd /c del .);
} catch (IOException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}

is an extremely good way to fuck someone over in a Java application, because it doesn’t show the console. Just run that and gtfo fast.

Read full topic

item.source: Running a batch file in java

item.title: Running a batch file in java
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

But the thing is, the batch file is in a different folder which is the thing buggering it all up. If the batch file was in the same folder I can get it to work…

When I try to get the batch file to run which is in another folder I try this:

Runtime.getRuntime().exec(“folder\batchfile.bat”);

and that doesn’t work and I also try:

Runtime.getRuntime().exec(“C:\folder\batchfile.bat”);

and that also doesn’t work for some reason…

Read full topic

item.title: Running a batch file in java
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Ok, I have been attempting to run a batch file in java. I have also been using many methods suggested by people although I can never get them to work Here is what I have been trying and aparently it should work but it doesn’t:

try { Process P; Runtime rt = Runtime.getRuntime(); P = rt.exec(path); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }

Where path is the path to the place I want. I know the path is completely correct but it just wont work. Can anyone help me Thanks

Read full topic
